meta.name: STEPS FETP India epidemiological configuration
meta.description: Default multipliers and indicative monetary values for graduates and outbreak responses used by the STEPS decision aid.
meta.author: Mesfin Genie and collaborators
meta.notes: Version 1.2 adds structured sections for time horizon, currency, tier specific multipliers and values, defaults, and ranges while preserving backwards compatibility with Versions 1.0 and 1.1. Version 1.3 adds explicit response time multipliers and outbreak response benefit parameters for DCE based sensitivity analysis, while preserving backwards compatibility with Versions 1.0 to 1.2. Version 1.4 aligns the core model with a default outbreak cost saving of INR 20,000,000,000 per large outbreak averted or substantially reduced, sets the core value per graduate to zero, and expands the outbreak value range to support sensitivity analysis between INR 10,000,000,000 and INR 100,000,000,000.
meta.intendedUse: These parameters are used to translate DCE derived willingness to pay for FETP programmes into indicative monetary benefits per graduate and per outbreak response over a specified planning horizon.

response_time_settings.notes: These settings describe the range of response times used when linking outbreak response capacity to relative benefits in the DCE sensitivity tab.

who_frontline_6_cohorts.label: WHO style Frontline programme (6 cohorts over horizon)
who_frontline_6_cohorts.notes: Illustrative template for a multi cohort frontline roll out; cost details are defined in the costing configuration.

who_intermediate_3_cohorts.label: WHO style Intermediate programme (3 cohorts over horizon)
who_intermediate_3_cohorts.notes: Illustrative template for intermediate FETP roll out.

who_advanced_2_cohorts.label: WHO style Advanced programme (2 cohorts over horizon)
who_advanced_2_cohorts.notes: Illustrative template for advanced FETP roll out.

graduationRate.label: Graduation rate (share of trainees graduating)
graduationRate.helpText: Proportion of trainees who successfully graduate from each cohort between 0 and 1.

outbreaksPerCohortPerYear.label: Outbreak responses per cohort per year
outbreaksPerCohortPerYear.helpText: Average number of outbreak responses that a cohort contributes to in a typical year.

valuePerGraduate.label: Non outbreak value per graduate per year (INR)
valuePerGraduate.helpText: User defined non outbreak benefit per graduate per year, such as improvements in surveillance or data quality. The core model sets this to zero to avoid overlap with outbreak cost savings; decision makers can turn it on in sensitivity analysis if they wish to add this channel separately.

valuePerOutbreak.label: Value per outbreak (INR)
valuePerOutbreak.helpText: Indicative economic cost saving per large outbreak averted or substantially reduced. The core model uses INR 20,000,000,000 as the baseline with sensitivity tests at 10, 20, and 50 billion, and expert options up to 100 billion.

planningHorizonYears.label: Planning horizon (years)
planningHorizonYears.helpText: Number of years over which costs and benefits are aggregated.

inrPerUsd.label: INR per USD (display)
inrPerUsd.helpText: Exchange rate used for displaying values in USD where required.

discountRateAnnual.label: Annual discount rate
discountRateAnnual.helpText: Annual discount rate applied to future costs and benefits, for example 0.03 for 3 percent.

baseline.label: Baseline (default)
baseline.description: Default configuration matching the core values used in the STEPS technical appendix, with zero non outbreak benefit per graduate and INR 20,000,000,000 per large outbreak averted or substantially reduced.

conservative.label: Conservative benefits
conservative.description: Reduces monetary benefits by 25 percent for all tiers, holding graduation rates and outbreaks per cohort fixed.

highImpact.label: High impact benefits
highImpact.description: Increases monetary benefits by 25 percent for all tiers, holding graduation rates and outbreaks per cohort fixed.

planningHorizonYears.description: Length of the planning horizon in years.

discountRateAnnual.description: Annual discount rate applied to future flows.

inrPerUsd.description: Exchange rate used for display conversions.

response_time_multipliers.description: Mapping from response time in days 7, 15, 30 to relative outbreak response benefit multipliers used in DCE based sensitivity analysis.

response_time_settings.description: Metadata and bounds for outbreak response times used when linking response time to benefits.
